CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy)
JUDGES: Aleš Pejchal;André Potocki;Angelika Nußberger;Ganna Yudkivska;Mark Villiger;Paul Lemmens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted a labour dispute before ORG seeking the annulment of the decisions of DATE and DATE whereby her contract had been terminated due to her unauthorised absence from work .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court delivered a judgment rejecting her request . She appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the appeal and remitted the case for re - examination . The appeal court found that the facts had not been properly established and that as a consequence the application of the law was also questionable .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court rejected the applicant ’s claim . She appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the appeal was rejected . The applicant lodged an appeal on points of law .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal . The applicant lodged a constitutional appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings before ORG seeking payment of benefits .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court delivered a judgment upholding her request in part . An appeal was lodged .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG remitted the case for re - examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court rendered a judgment . An appeal was lodged .
CARDINAL . On DATE the appeal was rejected and on DATE the appeal on points of law was rejected . The applicant lodged a constitutional appeal
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal as being lodged out of time .
